sections.heading: Intervention; judgment; costs.The court shall determine upon the intervention at the same time that the action is decided, and if the claim of the intervenor is not sustained, the intervenor shall pay all costs of the intervention
be liberally construed, but intervener must plead and prove actual interest or be regarded as mere interloper
sections.text: Parker v. City of Grand Island, 115 Neb. 892, 215 N.W. 127 (1927).
